Description: Blue glazed composition finger-ring: the ring is surmounted by an aegis of Sekhmet or Ra on a lotus flower. There are lotus leaves either side. Part of the shank is formed by the counterpoise. There is a chip off the back of the sun's disc.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Matmar, Grave 745. Found on the finger of a woman.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.45
